recommendations.title: What to Do When Your Child Is Being Bullied
recommendations.excerpt: When your child is the target of bullies, there are concrete ways you can help.

recommendations.title: A fitness trainer says this is how much exercise you should be doing a week: 'It's less than you might think'
recommendations.excerpt: You don't need as much exercise as you probably think. Fitness trainer Stephanie Mellinger shares how to make the most out of the minimum exercise you need per week.

recommendations.title: Unmasking Trickbot, One of the World’s Top Cybercrime Gangs
recommendations.excerpt: A WIRED investigation into a cache of documents posted by an unknown figure lays bare the Trickbot ransomware gang’s secrets, including the identity of a central member.

recommendations.title: Sriracha: the Good Kind of Heat
recommendations.excerpt: The spicy business of the world's most recognizable hot sauce.

recommendations.title: The Next Pandemic Could Strike Crops, Not People

recommendations.title: The Strange, Hidden Story of Harley Quinn

recommendations.title: Should You Visit Museums That Have Complicated Histories?
recommendations.excerpt: Museums play a powerful role in sharing knowledge and culture. How can we best engage with them, given ethical concerns about the acquisition of artifacts?

recommendations.title: 3 Myths Of Human Behavior That Could Be Costing You Money
recommendations.excerpt: Like most myths, each of these myths does have some truth to them.

recommendations.title: Runners can be disqualified for starting after the gun. What gives?
recommendations.excerpt: The rules of elite running say no one can start a race faster than 0.1 seconds. Scientists say that’s wrong.

recommendations.title: The housing crisis for the poor in India’s capital

recommendations.excerpt: Effortless and basic as the concept of Boiler Room seems, there is a lot that goes into making each show a unique experience and elevating its sonic aspect.

recommendations.excerpt: There are plenty of reasons why you might love celebrating your birthday — and just as many reasons for why you might hate it.

recommendations.title: Accessible Independent Travel Is for All Ages and Abilities
recommendations.excerpt: See the world “any which way” you can, says a seasoned traveler in her 70s.

recommendations.title: In India, Human Traffickers Target Tribal Women and Girls
recommendations.excerpt: Socially and economically marginalized tribes in India are vulnerable to traffickers' empty promise

recommendations.title: Reading quietly in a park has gone viral, thanks to Indian Instagram page Cubbon Reads – now there are chapters across the world
recommendations.excerpt: A book club without the talking? Cubbon Reads is a community reading initiative that takes place in a park in India’s Bangalore – participants quietly read their books and there is no marketing. The idea has gone global.

recommendations.title: How Jann Mardenborough went from Gran Turismo gamer to real-life racer
recommendations.excerpt: A gamer went behind the wheel more than a decade ago and turned into a race car driver. Now his story will play out on the big screen in the movie "Gran Turismo."

recommendations.title: Art, fame and fortune: The East India Company’s lucrative visual affair with India
recommendations.excerpt: From monuments and landscapes to the diverse people of the subcontinent land, European artists sketched, drew and painted colonised India in rich detail.

recommendations.title: How to plan a sustainable funeral

recommendations.title: The History Behind Saint Lucia's Indian Cuisine—and Where to Find It
recommendations.excerpt: Many people are surprised to find out there's good, authentic Indian food in Saint Lucia,” chef Vikram Singh says. “And I often use the opportunity to tell them the story behind each dish.”

recommendations.title: Why We Fight
recommendations.excerpt: Of the thirty fighters here tonight, only six of us are female. We arrive from all parts of the city, each harboring our reasons. We unfold the wings of our chest protectors and pull them around our sides. We turn to each other.

recommendations.title: Human Ancestors Nearly Went Extinct 900,000 Years Ago
recommendations.excerpt: A new technique analysing modern genetic data suggests that pre-humans survived in a group of only 1,280 individuals.

recommendations.title: This low-effort vegetable gardening method is genius way to grow crops in a small backyard
recommendations.excerpt: Do you want an easy way into gardening that doesn't require tonnes of space? Fancy growing a no-dig edible garden that incorporates all your favorite veg? Do you want it to yield the best harvest possible?

recommendations.title: In Japan, the young find dating so hard their parents are doing it for them
recommendations.excerpt: It’s a steamy summer afternoon in the Japanese city of Osaka, where a group of around 60 men and women have gathered for a session of “omiai,” or matchmaking, to find true love.

recommendations.title: Where India Dries Its Clothes: Karan Khosla's Photo Series Is Draping India's Diversity
recommendations.excerpt: Clothes, like the threads of our shared humanity, weave a tapestry that transcends borders and boundaries, revealing the universal nature of our need for self-expression and protection.

recommendations.title: Is Coffee Good for You? A Dermatologist, a Dietitian, and an Endocrinologist Weigh In
recommendations.excerpt: Cappuccino, Americano, latte, and cortado—I love them all. For a drink that’s been around for centuries, our obsession with coffee has yet to die down.
